title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Online investors who spurred a trading frenzy in the shares of GameStop and AMC moved into the silver market, propelling the metal to its biggest one-day advance in over a decade.

Robinhood raised an additional $2.4 billion from shareholders, days after investors agreed to pump $1 billion into the online brokerage to help it ride out frenetic trading in talked-up stocks.

---

Day traders fueling enormous gains in some stocks are also powering big swings in special-purpose acquisition companies.

Private-jet operator Wheels Up and the parent of Golden Nugget said they would go public by combining with blank-check firms.

Former Boeing CEO Muilenburg plans to raise $200 million for a special-purpose acquisition company.

---

The S&P 500 rebounded 1.6%, turning the index positive for the year to date, while the Dow rose 0.8% and the Nasdaq jumped 2.5%.

---

Facebook plans to roll out an in-app prompt aimed at educating users about the handling of their data as it battles Apple over the iPhone maker's privacy changes.

---

Some of the biggest U.S. retailers are preparing to take a central role in administering Covid-19 vaccines, hoping to avoid logjams and other complications.

---

Exxon is forming a business unit that will focus on technologies to lower carbon emissions, as the company faces pressure to step up its sustainability investments.
